question.title: Ninja And Alternating Largest
question.content:
Ninja is given a few numbers, and he is being asked to rearrange the numbers so that every second element is greater than its left and right element.

Suppose the given array is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] then the rearranged array can be [1, 3, 2, 5, 4].

Input Format:
The first line of input contains a single integer T, representing the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains ‘N’, denoting the number of elements in the array.

The second line of each test case contains the array elements.
Output Format :
The first and only line of each test case in the output contains 1 if the array satisfies the conditions mentioned.
Note:
If the array returned is the rearranged array following all the conditions, then it will print 1 else it will print 0.
You are not required to print the expected output; it has already been taken care of. Just implement the function.
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 10    
1 <= N <= 10^4
0 <= array[i] <= 10^5     

Time limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
2
7
1 2 3 4 5 6 7
4
8 2 4 6
Sample Output 1:
1 
1
Explanation for Sample Output 1:
In the first test case,  [1, 3, 2, 5, 4, 7, 6] is one possible answer. The reason is every second element of the array is greater than its left and right element. So on returning this 1 is the output.

In the second test case,  [2, 8, 4, 6] is one possible answer. The reason is every second element of the array is greater than its left and right element. So on returning this 1 is the output.
Sample Input 2:
2
6
9 7 1 2 9 6
3
3 2 1
Sample Output 2:
1
1

rephrased.body: Given an array of numbers, rearrange the elements such that every element at an even index (starting from index 1) is greater than its adjacent elements. Determine if such a rearrangement is possible.

testcases.explanation:
In the first test case, one possible rearrangement is [1, 3, 2, 5, 4, 7, 6]. Every second element (3, 5, 7) is greater than its adjacent elements. Therefore, the output is 1.

In the second test case, one possible rearrangement is [2, 8, 4, 6]. Every second element (8, 6) is greater than its adjacent elements. Therefore, the output is 1.

One possible arrangement for first testcase is [9, 9, 6, 7, 1, 2]. Every second element of the array is greater than its left and right element. 
One possible arrangement for second testcase is [2, 3, 1]. Every second element of the array is greater than its left and right element.
